   13: %% distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS,

   19: %%
   20: 
   21: -module(gen_tcp_socket_SUITE).
   22: 
   23: -compile([export_all, nowarn_export_all]).
   24: 
   25: -include_lib("common_test/include/ct_event.hrl").
   26: 
   27: all() ->
   28:     [{group, smoketest}].
   29: 
   30: groups() ->
   31:     [{smoketest,    [{group,small}]},
   32:      {benchmark,    [{group,small}, {group,medium},
   33:                      {group,large}, {group,huge}]},
   34:      %%
   35:      {dev,          [{group,dev_direct},
   36:                      {group,dev_inet}, {group,dev_socket}]},
   37:      {dev_inet,     [active_raw, active_true, active_false, active_once]},
   38:      {dev_socket,   [active_raw, active_true, active_false, active_once]},
   39:      {dev_direct,   testcases(direct)},
   40:      %%
   41:      {small,        backend_groups()},
   42:      {medium,       backend_groups()},
   43:      {large,        backend_groups()},
   44:      {huge,         backend_groups()},
   45:      %%
   46:      {inet,         testcases(active)},
   47:      {socket,       testcases(active)},
   48:      {direct,       testcases(direct)}].
   49: 
   50: backend_groups() ->
   51:     [{group,inet}, {group,socket}, {group,direct}].
   52: 
   53: testcases(active) ->
   54:     [active_raw, active_false, active_true, active_once,
   55:      active_1, active_5, active_20];
   56: testcases(direct) ->
   57:     [socket_raw, socket_packet, socket_packet_buf, socket_packet_cheat].
   58: 
   59: -define(SUITE, "gen_tcp_socket").
   60: -define(DOMAIN, inet).
   61: -define(NORM_EXP, 30).
   62: -define(BUFSIZE_EXP, 17).
   63: -define(BUFSIZE, (1 bsl ?BUFSIZE_EXP)).
   64: 
   65: init_per_suite(Config) ->
   66:     case socket:is_supported(protocols, tcp) of
   67:         true ->
   68:             ct:pal("socket:info():~n    ~p~n", [socket:info()]),
   69:             {ok, BindAddr} = kernel_test_lib:which_local_addr(?DOMAIN),
   70:             [{bind_addr, #{ family => ?DOMAIN, addr   => BindAddr }}
   71:             | Config];
   72:         false ->
   73:             {skip, "Socket not supported"}
   74:     end.
   75: 
   76: end_per_suite(_Config) ->
   77:     ct:pal("socket:info():~n    ~p~n", [socket:info()]),
   78:     ok.
   79: 
   80: 
   81: init_per_group(Nm, Config) ->
   82:     case Nm of
   83:         smoketest   -> [{burden,0} | Config];
   84:         benchmark   -> [{burden,2} | Config];
   85:         %%
   86:         dev         -> init_per_group(small, [{burden,3} | Config]);
   87:         dev_inet    -> [{backend,inet}   | Config];
   88:         dev_socket  -> [{backend,socket} | Config];
   89:         dev_direct  -> [{backend,direct} | Config];
   90:         %%
   91:         small       -> init_per_group_size(7, ?NORM_EXP - 7 - 3, Config);
   92:         medium      -> init_per_group_size(10, ?NORM_EXP - 10 - 1, Config);
   93:         large       -> init_per_group_size(15, ?NORM_EXP - 15, Config);
   94:         huge ->
   95:             init_per_group_size(
   96:               ?BUFSIZE_EXP + 2, ?NORM_EXP - (?BUFSIZE_EXP + 2), Config);
   97:         %%
   98:         _ when Nm =:= inet;
   99:                Nm =:= socket;
  100:                Nm =:= direct -> [{backend,Nm} | Config]
  101:     end.
  102: 
  103: init_per_group_size(K, L, Config) ->
  104:     %% 2^(K+1) = Max packet size -> 2^K = Mean packet size
  105:     %% 2^L = Number of packets
  106:     {_, Burden} = proplists:lookup(burden, Config),
  107:     M = L + Burden,
  108:     StopTag = spawn_testdata_server(K+1, (1 bsl M)),
  109:     %%
  110:     {MeanSize, SizeSuffix} = size_and_suffix(1 bsl K),
  111:     {PacketCount, CountSuffix} = size_and_suffix(1 bsl M),
  112:     ct:pal("Packet mean size: ~w ~sByte, packet count: ~w ~s",
  113:            [MeanSize, SizeSuffix, PacketCount, CountSuffix]),
  114:     %%
  115:     [{testdata_server,StopTag},
  116:      {testdata_size,  {K, M}} | Config].
  117: 
  118: size_and_suffix(P) ->
  119:     size_and_suffix(P, 1, ["", "K", "M", "T", "Z"]).
  120: %%
  121: size_and_suffix(P, _, []) ->
  122:     {P, ""};
  123: size_and_suffix(P, Q, Suffixes) ->
  124:     Q_1 = Q bsl 10,
  125:     if
  126:         is_integer(P), Q_1 =< P, P band (Q_1 - 1) =:= 0 ->
  127:             size_and_suffix(P, Q_1, tl(Suffixes));
  128:         Q bsl 13 =< P ->
  129:             size_and_suffix(P, Q_1, tl(Suffixes));
  130:         true ->
  131:             {round(P / Q), hd(Suffixes)}
  132:     end.
  133: 
  134: end_per_group(Nm, Config) ->
  135:     case Nm of
  136:         dev         -> end_per_group(benchmark, end_per_group(huge, Config));
  137:         dev_inet    -> end_per_group(inet, Config);
  138:         dev_socket  -> end_per_group(socket, Config);
  139:         dev_direct  -> end_per_group(direct, Config);
  140:         _ when Nm =:= smoketest;
  141:                Nm =:= dev;
  142:                Nm =:= benchmark -> proplists:delete(burden, Config);
  143:         _ when Nm =:= small;
  144:                Nm =:= medium;
  145:                Nm =:= large;
  146:                Nm =:= huge ->
  147:             case proplists:lookup(testdata_server, Config) of
  148:                 {_, StopTag} ->
  149:                     stop_testdata_server(StopTag),
  150:                     proplists:delete(
  151:                       testdata_server,
  152:                       proplists:delete(testdata_size, Config));
  153:                 none ->
  154:                     Config
  155:             end;
  156:         _ when Nm =:= inet;
  157:                Nm =:= socket;
  158:                Nm =:= direct -> proplists:delete(backend, Config)
  159:     end.
  160: 
  161: %% -------
  162: %% Testcases
  163: 
  164: -define(
  165:    XFER(Name),
  166:    Name(Config) -> xfer(Config, ?FUNCTION_NAME)).
  167: 
  168: ?XFER(active_raw).
  169: ?XFER(active_false).
  170: ?XFER(active_true).
  171: ?XFER(active_once).
  172: ?XFER(active_1).
  173: ?XFER(active_5).
  174: ?XFER(active_20).
  175: ?XFER(socket_raw).
  176: ?XFER(socket_packet).
  177: ?XFER(socket_packet_buf).
  178: ?XFER(socket_packet_cheat).
  179: 
  180: %% -------
  181: 
  182: tc2active(TC) ->
  183:     case TC of
  184:         active_raw      -> raw;
  185:         active_false    -> false;
  186:         active_true     -> true;
  187:         active_once     -> once;
  188:         active_1        -> 1;
  189:         active_5        -> 5;
  190:         active_20       -> 20
  191:     end.
  192: 
  193: xfer(Config, TC) when is_list(Config) ->
  194:     {_, Backend}        = proplists:lookup(backend, Config),
  195:     {_, TestdataSize}   = proplists:lookup(testdata_size, Config),
  196:     {_, BindAddr}       = proplists:lookup(bind_addr, Config),
  197:     run_xfer(TC, Backend, TestdataSize, BindAddr, testdata()).
  198: 
  199: run_xfer(
  200:   TC, Backend, {K,_} = TestdataSize, BindAddr, {Iovec, Sizes, TotalSize}) ->
  201:     Parent = self(),
  202:     Tag = make_ref(),
  203:     {Sender, Mref} =
  204:         spawn_opt(
  205:           fun () ->
  206:                   try
  207:                       %% Send an iovec efficiently
  208:                       {ok, L} =
  209:                           gen_tcp:listen(
  210:                             0, [{ifaddr,BindAddr}, {sndbuf, 2 bsl K}]),
  211:                       {ok, {IP,Port}} = inet:sockname(L),
  212:                       Sockaddr =
  213:                           #{family => inet, addr => IP, port => Port},
  214:                       Parent ! {Tag, Sockaddr},
  215:                       {ok, A} = gen_tcp:accept(L),
  216:                       ok = gen_tcp:close(L),
  217:                       ok = gen_tcp:send(A, Iovec),
  218:                       ok = gen_tcp:close(A)
  219:                   catch Class : Reason : Stacktrace ->
  220:                           ct:pal(
  221:                             "Sender crash [~w] ~w : ~p~n    ~p~n",
  222:                             [self(), Class, Reason, Stacktrace]),
  223:                           erlang:raise(Class, Reason, Stacktrace)
  224:                   end
  225:           end, [monitor]),
  226:     receive
  227:         {Tag, Sockaddr} ->
  228:             {ok, C} = connect(Backend, Sockaddr, TC),
  229:             try
  230:                 T1 = erlang:monotonic_time(),
  231:                 {ok, TotalSize} = recv_loop(C, Sizes, TC),
  232:                 T2 = erlang:monotonic_time(),
  233:                 T = erlang:convert_time_unit(T2 - T1, native, millisecond),
  234:                 report_MByte_s(Backend, TestdataSize, TC, TotalSize, T)
  235:             catch Class : Reason : Stacktrace ->
  236:                     ct:pal(
  237:                       "Receiver crash [~w] ~w : ~p~n    ~p~n",
  238:                       [self(), Class, Reason, Stacktrace]),
  239:                     exit(Sender, receiver_crash),
  240:                     %% spawn_link of Sender does not work since
  241:                     %% ct catches the below failure so this process
  242:                     %% doesn't die and the link doesn't trigger,
  243:                     %% therefore the explicit exit/2 above
  244:                     %%
  245:                     erlang:raise(Class, Reason, Stacktrace)
  246:             after
  247:                 close(Backend, C),
  248:                 receive {'DOWN',Mref,_,_,_} -> ok end
  249:             end;
  250:         {'DOWN',Mref,_,_,Reason} ->
  251:             error({sender_died,Reason})
  252:     end.
  253: 
  254: connect(direct, Sockaddr, _) ->
  255:     {ok, S} = socket:open(?DOMAIN, stream),
  256:     ok = socket:setopt(S, {socket,rcvbuf}, ?BUFSIZE),
  257:     ok = socket:setopt(S, {otp,rcvbuf},    ?BUFSIZE),
  258:     io:format("socket:connect [~p].~n", [Sockaddr]),
  259:     case socket:connect(S, Sockaddr) of
  260:         ok ->
  261:             {ok, S};
  262:         Error ->
  263:             Error
  264:     end;
  265: connect(Backend, Sockaddr, active_raw) -> % {active,true}, {packet,raw}
  266:     Opts =
  267:         [{inet_backend,Backend}, binary, {active,true},
  268:          ?DOMAIN, {recbuf,?BUFSIZE}],
  269:     io:format("gen_tcp:connect(~p, ~p).~n", [Sockaddr, Opts]),
  270:     gen_tcp:connect(Sockaddr, Opts);
  271: connect(Backend, Sockaddr, TC) ->
  272:     Opts =
  273:         [{inet_backend,Backend}, binary, {active,tc2active(TC)}, {packet,4},
  274:          ?DOMAIN, {recbuf,?BUFSIZE}],
  275:     io:format("gen_tcp:connect(~p, ~p).~n", [Sockaddr, Opts]),
  276:     gen_tcp:connect(Sockaddr, Opts).
  277: 
  278: 
  279: close(direct, S) ->
  280:     socket:close(S);
  281: close(_, S) ->
  282:     gen_tcp:close(S).
  283: 
  284: 
  285: report_MByte_s(Backend, {K, L}, TC, Size, Time) ->
  286:     ct:log("Size: ~w. Time: ~w.", [Size, Time]),
  287:     Name = io_lib:format("~w 2^(~w+~w)-~w", [Backend, K, L, TC]),
  288:     {Value, Suffix} = size_and_suffix(Size * 1000 / Time),
  289:     report(Name, Value, Suffix++"Byte/s").
  290: 
  291: 
  292: spawn_testdata_server(K, N) ->
  293:     Spawner   = self(),
  294:     Tag       = make_ref(),
  295:     {_, Mref} =
  296:         spawn_opt(
  297:           fun () ->
  298:                   register(?MODULE, self()),
  299:                   Testdata = generate_testdata(K, N),
  300:                   Spawner ! Tag,
  301:                   testdata_server(Tag, Testdata)
  302:           end, [monitor]),
  303:     receive
  304:         Tag ->
  305:             demonitor(Mref, [flush]),
  306:             Tag;
  307:         {'DOWN', Mref, _, _, Info} ->
  308:             error(Info)
  309:     end.
  310: 
  311: testdata_server(Tag, Testdata) ->
  312:     receive
  313:         {get, From} ->
  314:             From ! {From, Testdata},
  315:             testdata_server(Tag, Testdata);
  316:         Tag ->
  317:             ok
  318:     end.
  319: 
  320: stop_testdata_server(Tag) when is_reference(Tag) ->
  321:     case whereis(?MODULE) of
  322:         Pid when is_pid(Pid) ->
  323:             Ref = monitor(process, Pid),
  324:             Pid ! Tag,
  325:             receive {'DOWN', Ref, _, _, _} -> ok end
  326:     end.
  327: 
  328: testdata() ->
  329:     case whereis(?MODULE) of
  330:         Pid when is_pid(Pid) ->
  331:             Ref = monitor(process, ?MODULE, [{alias,reply_demonitor}]),
  332:             Pid ! {get, Ref},
  333:             receive
  334:                 {Ref, Testdata} ->
  335:                     Testdata;
  336:                 {'DOWN', Ref, _, _, Info} ->
  337:                     error(Info)
  338:             end
  339:     end.
  340: 
  341: generate_testdata(K, N) ->
  342:     Iovec = generate_iovec(K, N),
  343:     PacketSizes = [byte_size(Bin) - 4 || Bin <- Iovec],
  344:     TotalSize =
  345:         lists:foldl(
  346:           fun (Bin, Size) ->
  347:                   Size + byte_size(Bin)
  348:           end, 0, Iovec),
  349:     {Iovec, PacketSizes, TotalSize}.
  350: 
  351: generate_iovec(K, N) ->
  352:     DataBlock = create_data_block(1 bsl K),
  353:     Offsets   = generate_offsets(1 bsl K, N),
  354:     generate_iovec_1(Offsets, DataBlock).
  355: %%
  356: generate_iovec_1([], _) -> [];
  357: generate_iovec_1([Offset | Offsets], DataBlock) ->
  358:     <<_:Offset/binary, Bin/binary>> = DataBlock,
  359:     [Bin | generate_iovec_1(Offsets, DataBlock)].
  360: 
  361: %% Generate N offsets in the range 0 .. 2^K -1, == 0 mod 4
  362: %%
  363: generate_offsets(M, N) -> generate_offsets(M, N, []).
  364: %%
  365: generate_offsets(_, 0, Offsets) -> Offsets;
  366: generate_offsets(M, N, Offsets) ->
  367:     %% 0 =< Offset < 2^K - 1
  368:     %% Offset mod 4 == 0
  369:     Offset = (rand_sum(M bsr 3, 8) - 8) band -4,
  370:     generate_offsets(M, N - 1, [Offset | Offsets]).
  371: 
  372: %% Sum I number of rand values range N
  373: %%
  374: rand_sum(_, 0) -> 0;
  375: rand_sum(N, I) -> rand:uniform(N) + rand_sum(N, I - 1).
  376: 
  377: %% Create a data block that at every offset mod 4 == 0
  378: %% contains that number of bytes after, so at every
  379: %% such offset up to the end of the data block
  380: %% there is a valid packet 4 chunk
  381: %%
  382: create_data_block(M) -> create_data_block(M, <<>>).
  383: %%
  384: create_data_block(M, Bin) when is_integer(M), 4 =< M ->
  385:     %% M   :: Desired chunk size
  386:     %% Bin :: Accumulator, grows at the end
  387:     create_data_block(M - 4, <<Bin/binary, M:32>>);
  388: create_data_block(3 = M, Bin) -> <<Bin/binary, M:32, 3, 2, 1>>;
  389: create_data_block(2 = M, Bin) -> <<Bin/binary, M:32, 2, 1>>;
  390: create_data_block(1 = M, Bin) -> <<Bin/binary, M:32, 1>>;
  391: create_data_block(0 = M, Bin) -> <<Bin/binary, M:32>>.
  392: 
  393: 
  394: %% Receive all packets on the stream, return the total payload size
  395: %%
  396: recv_loop(S, Sizes, TC) ->
  397:     case TC of
  398:         socket_raw ->
  399:             Recv = fun (Socket) -> socket:recv(Socket, 0) end,
  400:             recv_loop_raw(S, 0, Recv);
  401:         socket_packet ->
  402:             recv_loop_packet(S, Sizes, 0, fun socket:recv/2);
  403:         socket_packet_buf ->
  404:             recv_loop_packet_buf(S, Sizes, 0, fun socket:recv/2);
  405:         socket_packet_cheat ->
  406:             recv_loop_packet_cheat(S, Sizes, 0, fun socket:recv/2);
  407:         active_raw ->
  408:             recv_loop_active_raw(S, 0);
  409:         active_false ->
  410:             Recv = fun (Socket) -> gen_tcp:recv(Socket, 0) end,
  411:             recv_loop_active_false(S, Sizes, 0, Recv);
  412:         active_true ->
  413:             recv_loop_active_true(S, Sizes, 0);
  414:         active_once ->
  415:             recv_loop_active_once(S, Sizes, 0);
  416:         _ ->
  417:             recv_loop_active_n(S, Sizes, 0, tc2active(TC))
  418:     end.
  419: 
  420: %% -------
  421: %% These ignore packet borders and just count the total number of bytes
  422: 
  423: recv_loop_active_raw(S, M) ->
  424:     receive
  425:         {tcp, S, Data} ->
  426:             DataSize = byte_size(Data),
  427:             recv_loop_active_raw(S, M + DataSize);
  428:         {tcp_closed, S} ->
  429:             {ok, M};
  430:         {tcp_error, S, Reason} ->
  431:             {error, Reason}
  432:     end.
  433: 
  434: recv_loop_raw(S, M, Recv) ->
  435:     case Recv(S) of
  436:         {ok, Data} ->
  437:             DataSize = byte_size(Data),
  438:             recv_loop_raw(S, M + DataSize, Recv);
  439:         {error, closed} ->
  440:             {ok, M};
  441:         {error, _} = Error ->
  442:             Error
  443:     end.
  444: 
  445: %% -------
  446: %% These implement {packet,4}
  447: 
  448: %% Read packet header then packet body with separate Recv calls
  449: %%
  450: recv_loop_packet(_S, [], M, _Recv) ->
  451:     {ok, M};
  452: recv_loop_packet(S, [Size|Sizes], M, Recv) ->
  453:     case Recv(S, 4) of
  454:         {ok, <<Size:32>>} ->
  455:             case Recv(S, Size) of
  456:                 {ok, Bin} when is_binary(Bin) ->
  457:                     recv_loop_packet(S, Sizes, M + 4 + Size, Recv);
  458:                 Err2 ->
  459:                     Err2
  460:             end;
  461:         Err1 ->
  462:             Err1
  463:     end.
  464: 
  465: %% Use Recv(0) and then parse the received binary into packets.
  466: %%
  467: recv_loop_packet_buf(S, Sizes, M, Recv) ->
  468:     case Recv(S, 0) of
  469:         {ok, Data} when 0 < byte_size(Data) ->
  470:             recv_loop_packet_buf(S, Sizes, M, Recv, Data);
  471:         {error, closed} ->
  472:             [] = Sizes,
  473:             {ok, M};
  474:         {error, _} = Error ->
  475:             Error
  476:     end.
  477: %%
  478: recv_loop_packet_buf(S, Sizes, M, Recv, Buf) ->
  479:     %% Buf is a binary(), no fancy queue
  480:     %%
  481:     case Buf of
  482:         <<PacketSize:32, _:PacketSize/binary, Rest/binary>> ->
  483:             PacketSize = hd(Sizes),
  484:             NewM = M + 4 + PacketSize,
  485:             recv_loop_packet_buf(S, tl(Sizes), NewM, Recv, Rest);
  486:         <<PacketSize:32, Start/binary>> ->
  487:             %% Partial packet.
  488:             %% Keep it simple and read the rest of the packet with Recv(N).
  489:             %% We could also Recv(0) to get more data but that
  490:             %% would complicate handling of Start + Rest.
  491:             %% This is hopefully a rare case for small packets
  492:             %% and a small overhead for large packets..
  493:             RestSize = PacketSize - byte_size(Start),
  494:             case Recv(S, RestSize) of
  495:                 {ok, Rest} when byte_size(Rest) =:= RestSize->
  496:                     Packet = <<Start/binary, Rest/binary>>,
  497:                     PacketSize = byte_size(Packet),
  498:                     NewM = M + 4 + PacketSize,
  499:                     PacketSize = hd(Sizes),
  500:                     recv_loop_packet_buf(S, tl(Sizes), NewM, Recv);
  501:                 {error, _} = Error ->
  502:                     Error
  503:             end;
  504:         <<>> ->
  505:             recv_loop_packet_buf(S, Sizes, M, Recv);
  506:         <<Head/binary>> ->
  507:             %% Partial header.
  508:             %% Keep it simple and just Recv(N) the rest of the header.
  509:             %% Using Recv(0) would complicate the code greatly.
  510:             %% This is hopefully a rare case for small packets
  511:             %% and a small overhead for large packets..
  512:             RestSize = 4 - byte_size(Head),
  513:             case Recv(S, RestSize) of
  514:                 {ok, Rest} when byte_size(Rest) =:= RestSize->
  515:                     Data = <<Head/binary, Rest/binary>>,
  516:                     recv_loop_packet_buf(S, Sizes, M, Recv, Data);
  517:                 {error, _} = Error ->
  518:                     Error
  519:             end
  520:     end.
  521: 
  522: %% Cheating - we know the next packet size and receive exactly
  523: %% that in one Recv call, and verify the packet header
  524: %%
  525: recv_loop_packet_cheat(_S, [], M, _Recv) ->
  526:     {ok, M};
  527: recv_loop_packet_cheat(S, [Size|Sizes], M, Recv) ->
  528:     case Recv(S, 4 + Size) of
  529:         {ok, <<Size:32, _:Size/binary>>} ->
  530:             recv_loop_packet_cheat(S, Sizes, M + 4 + Size, Recv);
  531:         Err1 ->
  532:             Err1
  533:     end.
  534: 
  535: %% -------
  536: %% These assume that the socket is in {packet,4} mode
  537: 
  538: recv_loop_active_false(S, Sizes, M, Recv) ->
  539:     case Recv(S) of
  540:         {ok, Data} ->
  541:             DataSize = byte_size(Data),
  542:             DataSize = hd(Sizes),
  543:             recv_loop_active_false(S, tl(Sizes), M + DataSize + 4, Recv);
  544:         {error, closed} ->
  545:             [] = Sizes,
  546:             {ok, M};
  547:         {error, _} = Error ->
  548:             Error
  549:     end.
  550: 
  551: recv_loop_active_true(S, Sizes, M) ->
  552:     receive
  553:         {tcp, S, Data} ->
  554:             DataSize = byte_size(Data),
  555:             DataSize = hd(Sizes),
  556:             recv_loop_active_true(S, tl(Sizes), M + DataSize + 4);
  557:         {tcp_closed, S} ->
  558:             Sizes = [],
  559:             {ok, M};
  560:         {tcp_error, S, Reason} ->
  561:             {error, Reason}
  562:     end.
  563: 
  564: recv_loop_active_once(S, Sizes, M) ->
  565:     receive
  566:         {tcp, S, Data} ->
  567:             DataSize = byte_size(Data),
  568:             DataSize = hd(Sizes),
  569:             ok = inet:setopts(S, [{active,once}]),
  570:             recv_loop_active_once(S, tl(Sizes), M + DataSize + 4);
  571:         {tcp_closed, S} ->
  572:             Sizes = [],
  573:             {ok, M};
  574:         {tcp_error, S, Reason} ->
  575:             {error, Reason}
  576:     end.
  577: 
  578: recv_loop_active_n(S, Sizes, M, N) ->
  579:     receive
  580:         {tcp, S, Data} ->
  581:             DataSize = byte_size(Data),
  582:             DataSize = hd(Sizes),
  583:             recv_loop_active_n(S, tl(Sizes), M + DataSize + 4, N);
  584:         {tcp_passive, S} ->
  585:             ok = inet:setopts(S, [{active,N}]),
  586:             recv_loop_active_n(S, Sizes, M, N);
  587:         {tcp_closed, S} ->
  588:             Sizes = [],
  589:             {ok, M};
  590:         {tcp_error, S, Reason} ->
  591:             {error, Reason}
  592:     end.
  593: 
  594: %% -------
  595: 
  596: report(Name, Value, Suffix) ->
  597:     ct:pal("### ~s: ~w ~s", [Name, Value, Suffix]),
  598:     ct_event:notify(
  599:       #event{
  600:          name = benchmark_data,
  601:          data = [{value, Value}, {suite, ?SUITE}, {name, Name}]}),
  602:     {comment, term_to_string(Value) ++ " " ++ Suffix}.
  603: 
  604: term_to_string(Term) ->
  605:     unicode:characters_to_list(io_lib:write(Term, [{encoding, unicode}])).
